abstracts.cdata!:
The Xinjiang Highway Project's
            outcome is rated as satisfactory. Three main lessons were
            drawn from the project: 1) There is a need to adopt a more
            cautious approach to traffic forecasting, particularly on
            toll roads in provinces in China's hinterland, as
            demonstrated by two seemingly contradictory events that
            occurred under the project: Early on, the project was
            modified to allow for the upgrading from 2 lanes to 4 lanes
            of some sections of Turpan-Urumqi-Dahuangshan Highway;
            however later on, it was found that the actual traffic was
            far below expectations, not only the new road but also in
            the whole corridor. 2) Traffic accidents rates in China
            continue to raise serious concerns. One should not
            underestimate the risks, nor should one have too high
            expectations within one single project. 3) The efficiency of
            technical assistance (TA) in Highway Projects has sometimes
            been questioned in terms of high costs and limited
            effectiveness as perceived by some provinces. The TA
            provided for the studies under this project has been
            considered successful by all parties involved in terms of
            outcome, and the ingredients for success appear to be firm
            grounding in a sectoral strategy, supporter from MOC as well
            as the concerned provinces, good selection of local and
            international teams, and appropriate arrangements for the
            conduct of the studies and their dissemination.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Xinjian Highway Project's main
            objective is to support continuing development of road
            infrastructure to facilitate mobility and increase the
            efficiency of road transport in the interest of stimulating
            economic activity. To achieve this objective the project
            proposes the construction of a 283.3 km highway between
            Turpan, Urumqi and Dahuangshan, as well as the construction,
            rehabilitation and upgrading of six roads which will
            interconnect and feed traffic to the proposed highway at
            major intersections and interchanges. In conjunction with
            this main objective the project also sets out to promote the
            development of institutional capabilities of Xinjiang
            highway agencies for transport planning and investment
            prioritization, construction and maintenance through a
            series of technical assistance, institutional development,
            and training programs, which will also focus on road safety
            and the increased efficiency of road transport.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Xinjiang Provincial Highway Project
            : an executive summary of the environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The environmental assessment report is
            based on a study on the current environmental impacts of
            relevant social, physical, ecological, noise, air quality,
            cultural relic and historic sites along the highway corridor
            200-1000 meters within both sides of the Xinjiang provincial
            highway.  The report covers the following impacts: 1) air
            quality and influence upon air circumstance by vehicular
            tail gas; 2) acoustic environment and influence upon it by
            traffic noise and construction noise; 3) grassland, present
            agricultural conditions and impacts of the project; 4) wild
            animals and impacts of the project; 5) the project influence
            upon surface water; 6) social economy; 7) analysis on risk
            of the highway project; and 8) analysis on economic profit
            and loss of environmental influence of the project.

docna.cdata!:
China - Xinjiang Provincial Highway Project
            : an executive summary of the environmental assessment

China - Xinjiang Provincial
